title: YellowSwap
author: YellowSwap
content: Did anyone buy the RTX A2000 lately? I am trying to see the cost of this graphic card, this is the only gpu on my mind in this bear market but I cant fins good price yet, why is this A series more costly than other RTX.

comments.author: JayDDee
comments.body: I know how you feel. It kiils me that I can't get Lamborghini at a reasobale price.

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: It's not only you, I never found any A2000 to sell in my country, and if we try to import, we have to pay at least 50% of tax (minumum) and IF we find a seller who send abroad.Maybe the best person to find good deals of GPUs here is @philipma1957 If he see this thread, he can possibly know where to find

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.created_time: August 13, 2022, 02:14:43 AMLast edit: August 13, 2022, 02:28:31 AM by philipma1957
comments.body: a2000 6gb low $500a2000 12gb mid $600at those prices I have been getting rtx 3060 at 350 after discountsI use retailmenot it gives me 4% off best buyI use bestbuy cc it gives me 5% off best buy.this pny 3060 does 110 watts and 48 mhthe pny is available at Best Buy for 389 I get 9% off and pay 7% tax so -2% means it costs me 381 usd.it works better for mean I have elite status with Best Buy and can use it for 45 days before a return it.It is my got to buy right now.But if I could get some a2000 cheap say 385 I would take the 6gb models they are no where to be found.to me the Best Buy link below is  besthttps://www.bestbuy.com/site/pny-nvidia-geforce-rtx-3060-12gb-xlr8-gaming-revel-epic-x-rgb-dual-fan-graphics-card/6454319.p?skuId=6454319

comments.author: MetaMii
comments.body: This is stupid, I won't fall for the beauty of a gpu over having a higher hashrate and a good power power consumption, I can get 3060ti for 430$-450$ and that's 60MH, do the math and see for yourself, can a 500$ A2000 give you 60MH?.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: YellowSwap on August 12, 2022, 04:10:06 PMDid anyone buy the RTX A2000 lately? I am trying to see the cost of this graphic card, this is the only gpu on my mind in this bear market but I cant fins good price yet, why is this A series more costly than other RTX. Do not buy video cards now. The price of ethereum has risen and the prices of video cards are not falling. Start monitoring the markets after September 20, when the profit in mining on video cards will be minimal and there will be many interesting offers on the market.

comments.author: P00P135
comments.body: Should see one more huge price cut on 3XXX GPU's before the launch of 4XXX next month.  I don't expect the 4XXX to better efficiency for memory intensive algos since they are crippling a lot of the memory bus bandwidths,  but it should pack a punch for core intensive algos like flux and rvn.

comments.author: S3300
comments.body: The graphic cards with the most ridiculous price right now are the A2000 and A4000, even the RTX3090Ti can be get at a fairly better price that the A series, stay away from these because we are in a bear market and it doesn't feel like a bear market the A series graphic cards.

comments.author: Rikimaruu
comments.body: The A2000 and other do have an advantage when LHR was still a thing but now its not a must have, in fact I prefer buying LHR graphic cards over this A2000 because we are not in a bull market.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: P00P135 on August 14, 2022, 02:18:59 AMShould see one more huge price cut on 3XXX GPU's before the launch of 4XXX next month.  I don't expect the 4XXX to better efficiency for memory intensive algos since they are crippling a lot of the memory bus bandwidths,  but it should pack a punch for core intensive algos like flux and rvn.The RTX 4090 and RTX 4080 will only compete with the top Nvidia models. I think they will be mining hotter than the RTX 3090 and RTX 3080, with cooler versions going on sale in Q1 2023. During that time, the overstocking issue will be resolved

comments.author: BitKongy
comments.body: You cant change peoples mind when it comes to their desires, its how I have a friend who wants a gpu and I told him to go for rx580 8gb since its very cheap right now but he went for RTX 2060 super, he said he likes this better.

comments.author: ccplz
comments.body: why not get a 5700(XT) with TRM R-mode for even higher efficiency?

comments.author: Pterosaur
comments.body: Quote from: ccplz on August 15, 2022, 05:13:12 AMwhy not get a 5700(XT) with TRM R-mode for even higher efficiency?I am guessing they should be cheaper now? I still have one mixed with RX vega 64 rig and it still works, I remember when I bought it the GPU gives me lot of problem, it keeps crashing every few minutes and later I sent it back to the store and they told me the GPU is working fine, that's when I tried switching my PSU and the problem was gone.

comments.author: ccplz
comments.body: Quote from: Pterosaur on August 15, 2022, 01:10:31 PMQuote from: ccplz on August 15, 2022, 05:13:12 AMwhy not get a 5700(XT) with TRM R-mode for even higher efficiency?I am guessing they should be cheaper now? I still have one mixed with RX vega 64 rig and it still works, I remember when I bought it the GPU gives me lot of problem, it keeps crashing every few minutes and later I sent it back to the store and they told me the GPU is working fine, that's when I tried switching my PSU and the problem was gone. I found them used for 400 euros in the previous few months. They need finetuning as do most AMD cards but it's worth the effort.

comments.author: Widdop37
comments.body: Quote from: ccplz on August 15, 2022, 07:44:44 PMQuote from: Pterosaur on August 15, 2022, 01:10:31 PMQuote from: ccplz on August 15, 2022, 05:13:12 AMwhy not get a 5700(XT) with TRM R-mode for even higher efficiency?I am guessing they should be cheaper now? I still have one mixed with RX vega 64 rig and it still works, I remember when I bought it the GPU gives me lot of problem, it keeps crashing every few minutes and later I sent it back to the store and they told me the GPU is working fine, that's when I tried switching my PSU and the problem was gone. I found them used for 400 euros in the previous few months. They need finetuning as do most AMD cards but it's worth the effort.Not worth the effort, 400euros for 54 MH is not as good as a RTX 3070 used or 3060To used, if you can get the RX 5700XT for used at 400 euros then I should be able to get 3070 and 3060Ti for less since the new is 430$ here and they do 61 to 62MH.

comments.author: ccplz
comments.body: Quote from: Widdop37 on August 16, 2022, 07:53:56 AMQuote from: ccplz on August 15, 2022, 07:44:44 PMQuote from: Pterosaur on August 15, 2022, 01:10:31 PMQuote from: ccplz on August 15, 2022, 05:13:12 AMwhy not get a 5700(XT) with TRM R-mode for even higher efficiency?I am guessing they should be cheaper now? I still have one mixed with RX vega 64 rig and it still works, I remember when I bought it the GPU gives me lot of problem, it keeps crashing every few minutes and later I sent it back to the store and they told me the GPU is working fine, that's when I tried switching my PSU and the problem was gone. I found them used for 400 euros in the previous few months. They need finetuning as do most AMD cards but it's worth the effort.Not worth the effort, 400euros for 54 MH is not as good as a RTX 3070 used or 3060To used, if you can get the RX 5700XT for used at 400 euros then I should be able to get 3070 and 3060Ti for less since the new is 430$ here and they do 61 to 62MH. depends on the market. I checked yesterday in my country and used 5700 XTs go for 350-380 euros. Used 3060 TIs go for 450+. 5700s can do 54 mh/s at 110w from the wall with TRM R-mode, compared to 60 mh/s at 140w for 3060 ti. I don't have a 3060ti so correct me if my numbers are wrong.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: ccplz on August 16, 2022, 01:11:58 PMQuote from: Widdop37 on August 16, 2022, 07:53:56 AMQuote from: ccplz on August 15, 2022, 07:44:44 PMQuote from: Pterosaur on August 15, 2022, 01:10:31 PMQuote from: ccplz on August 15, 2022, 05:13:12 AMwhy not get a 5700(XT) with TRM R-mode for even higher efficiency?I am guessing they should be cheaper now? I found them used for 400 euros in the previous few months. They need finetuning as do most AMD cards but it's worth the effort.Not worth the effort, 400euros for 54 MH is not as good as a RTX 3070 used or 3060To used, if you can get the RX 5700XT for used at 400 euros then I should be able to get 3070 and 3060Ti for less since the new is 430$ here and they do 61 to 62MH. depends on the market. I checked yesterday in my country and used 5700 XTs go for 350-380 euros. Used 3060 TIs go for 450+. 5700s can do 54 mh/s at 110w from the wall with TRM R-mode, compared to 60 mh/s at 140w for 3060 ti. I don't have a 3060ti so correct me if my numbers are wrong.  3060 ti can do 59-60 at 115-120 watts.I am still grabbing new pny 3060 i pay $350 after discounts.2 year warranty45 days to returni got 4 of them so far.i also grabbed 2 asus dual 3060 for $345 they have three year warranty new.30 day return period.so six cards just around 290 mhcost me 2300 with board and mobo. all neware they worth it most likely no but I grabbed them anyway.

comments.author: GEMIN_M4
comments.body: Quote from: ccplz on August 16, 2022, 01:11:58 PMQuote from: Widdop37 on August 16, 2022, 07:53:56 AMQuote from: ccplz on August 15, 2022, 07:44:44 PMQuote from: Pterosaur on August 15, 2022, 01:10:31 PMQuote from: ccplz on August 15, 2022, 05:13:12 AMwhy not get a 5700(XT) with TRM R-mode for even higher efficiency?I am guessing they should be cheaper now? I still have one mixed with RX vega 64 rig and it still works, I remember when I bought it the GPU gives me lot of problem, it keeps crashing every few minutes and later I sent it back to the store and they told me the GPU is working fine, that's when I tried switching my PSU and the problem was gone. I found them used for 400 euros in the previous few months. They need finetuning as do most AMD cards but it's worth the effort.Not worth the effort, 400euros for 54 MH is not as good as a RTX 3070 used or 3060To used, if you can get the RX 5700XT for used at 400 euros then I should be able to get 3070 and 3060Ti for less since the new is 430$ here and they do 61 to 62MH. depends on the market. I checked yesterday in my country and used 5700 XTs go for 350-380 euros. Used 3060 TIs go for 450+. 5700s can do 54 mh/s at 110w from the wall with TRM R-mode, compared to 60 mh/s at 140w for 3060 ti. I don't have a 3060ti so correct me if my numbers are wrong. Wrong, RTX 3060Ti using 140watt is exaggerated, upon all the 3060Ti ive used to built rigs for myself and friends I haven't seen one taking more than 115watts, I have heard the rumour of 120watt on Hynix memory but I still believe the owners aren't finding the right OC combination.

comments.author: YellowSwap
comments.body: So has anyone been able to get A2000 graphic cards in this bear market? This GPU is very scarce over here and I need them, too bad.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: YellowSwap on March 01, 2023, 05:25:06 AMSo has anyone been able to get A2000 graphic cards in this bear market? This GPU is very scarce over here and I need them, too bad. In Ebay you can get them brand new less than 500 right now and there are a lot of them,you can also find them there with a very good price pre owned,I don't know if they have been used for mining but judging that they were removed from Dell or HP computers I highly doubt these used cards have been used for mining and the used price is 300 dollars and in a very few cases you can even find it for less.I don't know what is your import duties but right now seem that there are a lot of these cards available and at their power consumption they for me can be considered a very good deal at these prices.
